pageContext.description:
A cast copper alloy flat axe dating from the Early Bronze Age, that is about 2200 BC - 1900 BC. The axe is narrow with tapering sides. It has an oblique butt and is lenticular in cross-section. The sides curve outwards to form the tips of the cuttin edge, and there is no edge bevel. There is no sign of a stop ridge nor any flanges. The surface is pitted and corroded and the remaining surface has a  speckled light green patina. Measurements; length 96.5mm, width 48.5mm (cutting edge)  28.2mm at the( butt end), thickness 8.6mm ( body), 7.8mm  (butt end) 6.4mm (cutting edge). the weight is 162.9g.

Compare SWYOR-9EC7C9 and LANCUM-E3C336.  This axe shares similarities with axes of the Migdale, Brithdir and Willerby metalwork traditions (Rohl and Needham 1990, 102), EBA II - III.
